trans-unit.source: Used by a form to paginate its controls.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
During pagination, a ControlPager object is passed to each control on the form, and is used by the control to determine the control's page index.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager"></xref> class for the specified form that uses the specified weight for a page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The form page.
The weight of the specified form page.
Returns the assigned weight for a page.
This field is read-only.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The choice of units that you use for optimum page weight and control weights is flexible.
Because device adapters can provide both types of weights, a set of adapters can coordinate an appropriate convention for weight units.
However, if you follow the default unit system, your adapters can use the default weights of controls.
The default unit system is based on one line equaling 100 units, as indicated by the constant DefaultWeight.
To be added.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ItemPager"></xref> object for paginating the contents of the given control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The control to be paginated.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ItemPager"></xref> object.
The maximum number of items on a page.
The optimum weight of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ItemPager"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ItemPager"></xref> for paginating the contents of the given control.
Returns a newly assigned page index based on the weight of the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Controls call this method iteratively during pagination to retrieve their assigned pages.
The weight of a control.
A newly assigned page index based on the weight of the control.
Sets or returns the number of form pages currently created by the pager.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The number of form pages currently created by the pager.
Returns the optimal weight of a form page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The optimal weight of a form page.
Sets or returns the weight that remains on the current ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The weight that remains on the current ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page.
Returns whether to use the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager.DefaultWeight"></xref> field for pagination.
This field is read-only.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager> class and change this field and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager.DefaultWeight> field, if you need to use some value other than the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ControlPager.DefaultWeight> field as the default weight for a page.
To be added.
